intro: Adelobotrys saxosus, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to arid and rocky regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Adelobotrys saxosus is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
